comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Great photo. From the wikipedia article that - "In 1904 'Polly Woodside' was sold to A.H. Turnbull of New Zealand and renamed 'Rona' after Miss Rona Monro, daughter of a shareholder in the company. " en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polly_Woodside Which puts this photo as after 1904.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Its a bit of a mystery this one, the image looks very similar to the one held by the National Library of New Zealand by James Kinnear, (down to marks on the sails). But I guess that sky and sea could technically be anywhere...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia]Forgot to say - this image comes from a collection of William Hall pics, jury is still out though!
